2.16.1.title: Overview
2.16.1.content:
Subsea operations have unique well control requirements:

**Key Differences:**
- BOP at seabed, not at surface
- Floating vessel (MODU or drillship)
- Riser connecting vessel to BOP
- Long choke and kill lines
- ROV support for BOP observation/intervention
- Emergency disconnect capability required

**Implications:**
- Longer response times for some functions
- Choke line friction affects kill calculations
- Vessel positioning critical
- Must be able to disconnect and drift off if needed

2.16.2.title: Subsea BOP Configuration
2.16.2.content:
**Typical Stack:**
- LMRP (Lower Marine Riser Package) - upper section
- BOP Stack - lower section mounted on wellhead

**LMRP Contains:**
- Annular preventers
- Flex joint
- Riser connector
- LMRP connector (allows disconnect from stack)

**BOP Stack Contains:**
- Pipe rams
- Blind shear rams
- Casing shear rams (in some configurations)
- Choke and kill outlets

**Control Systems:**
- Hydraulic control from surface
- Acoustic backup control
- ROV intervention capability
- Autoshear/deadman (automatic disconnect triggers)

2.16.3.title: Subsea Well Control Procedures
2.16.3.content:
**Detection:**
- Same indicators as surface operations
- PWD valuable due to water depth
- May have slight delay in surface indication

**Shut-In:**
- Standard procedure applies
- BOP function times account for subsea delay
- ROV can confirm function activation

**Kill Operations:**
- Low Choke Pressure Method required (Section 2.8)
- Account for choke line friction
- Longer circulating times
- Plan for extended operations

**Monitoring:**
- Subsea control system status
- Hydraulic fluid levels and pressure
- ROV observation as needed
- Riser tension and vessel position

2.16.4.title: Emergency Disconnect System (EDS)
2.16.4.content:
**Purpose:**
Allows rapid disconnection of vessel from well in emergency:
- Vessel drive-off or drift-off
- Severe weather
- Riser damage
- Fire/explosion on vessel
- Other emergency requiring immediate departure

**Sequence:**
1. Close shear rams (cuts pipe if in hole)
2. Close blind rams below shear
3. Unlatch LMRP connector
4. Vessel moves away with riser
5. Well secured by closed BOP on seabed

**Automatic Triggers:**
- Autoshear: activates if LMRP unlatches without EDS command
- Deadman: activates if communication lost for set period

2.16.5.title: When to Disconnect
2.16.5.content:
**Required:**
- Vessel cannot maintain position
- Riser integrity compromised
- Fire or explosion requiring vessel evacuation
- Environmental emergency

**Not Typically Required:**
- Normal well control event (can handle while connected)
- Minor vessel issues (thrusters, power if backup available)
- Weather within operating limits

**Decision Authority:**
- Captain/OIM has authority for vessel safety
- Drilling Supervisor involved in timing if possible
- May be automatic (autoshear/deadman) in sudden events

**Goal:**
Secure the well before disconnecting. If time permits:
1. Shut in well
2. Confirm rams closed
3. Then disconnect

If no time: EDS will close and disconnect simultaneously.

2.16.6.title: Riser Margin
2.16.6.content:
**Concept:**
If riser disconnects, mud in riser is lost. Wellbore sees only seawater hydrostatic above BOP.

**Riser Margin:**
Additional mud weight carried to ensure well remains overbalanced even if riser mud is lost.

Riser Margin = (MW - Seawater density) Ã— (Water depth / TVD)

**Application:**
- Always consider when setting mud weight
- May not be fully achievable in narrow margin wells
- Operational decision based on risk assessment
- If riser margin not carried, immediate disconnect becomes more risky

2.16.7.title: Post-Disconnect Operations
2.16.7.content:
**Well Status:**
- BOP closed on seabed
- Well secured (assuming successful EDS)
- ROV can inspect BOP visually

**Reconnection:**
1. Weather/conditions must allow
2. Lower riser and reconnect to LMRP
3. Test connection
4. Verify well status through BOP
5. Resume operations per situation

**If Unable to Reconnect:**
- Well remains secured by BOP
- May need relief vessel
- ROV can perform some interventions
- Long-term plan required

**Documentation:**
- Record all EDS activations
- Document reason and conditions
- Post-event review and investigation
